intro: Talinum cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf talinum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms. Talinum cuneifolium is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
